website_summaries.verdict: The highly rated Panasonic eneloop is the clear winner when it comes to rechargeable AA batteries. Users love their consistency and the fact that they can be recharged when fully or partially discharged.
pros: These batteries come precharged from the factory
They are recommended for digital cameras, computer mice and keyboards, and gaming devices
cons: A small number of users report individual cells sometimes wouldn't hold a charge after 3 or more uses

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money if you use lots of AA batteries.
customer_reviews.text: i was introduced to these batteries back in 2011 and I have been using them since. I decided to purchase these new gen 16 pack eneloops and I am not disappointed. Long lasting batteries come charged a little over half out the box ready to use. I use them for flashlights and Roku because they are my high drain devicec. I added a photo to my batteries with the box I use to store them. Great way to keep track of old and new batteries. Also the upside down means that they are not charged and right side up means that they are fully charged. Worth the buy
customer_reviews.author: M Altaf

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive Packaging - Not Legit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 16 pack of Eneloop batteries, but received a deceptive product instead. Everything looked fine at first glace, but once i took the batteries out of the packaging and began putting them into my battery storage containers i realized i was missing 4 batteries! Did i misplace them? no? then i looked at the package.... in the top right corner is says AA 16, however, there were only 12 included. Deceptive packaging!! Now i'm really suspicious... so i get my Nitecore charger out to see if they are what they say they are. Nope. These batteries are suppose to be pre-charged with a minimum 1900 mAh but they aren't. BUYER BEWARE - LOOK AT WHAT YOU GET.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: counterfeit most likely.capacity only 900mAh.NOT 1900 mA
customer_reviews.text: replaced twice. the first thing after receiving the batteries, i discharge and recharge them. it turned out only to have 900 to 1000mAh of this batch. I have tried them all out and all yielded the same result. I requested replacement once already, and the 2nd batch still give only 900mAh capacity. For a brand new battery of eneloop AA this is very supicious. my 5 year-old AA eneloop still have capacity of 1900-2050mAh!!! I suspected that amazon stocking was infiltrated with counterfeit eneloop batteries. I will give it one more replacement trial and will update accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Tester

customer_reviews.title: lower voltage than in the past...
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying eneloop batteries since they came out. They promoted them appropriately as long shelf life and long life in general, and proved it by always being 1.31volts when purchased. However I bought these recently and also in 2017 in this same package size, from Amazon. and both of these sets were at 1.25volts when opened, AND do not charge past that, or settle quickly to 1.25 volts just sitting unused for a day or so. So, my conclusion is that these are OLD stock, very old. Others complaining of low power or short life also points in that direction: they are very OLD stock. I DO NOT recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Billtech66

customer_reviews.title: Great batteries
customer_reviews.text: Cannot say enough good about these. The store well, they hold their charge on the shelf for months, and they recharge again and again. Panasonic says about 2,100 times. I don't know. I've never gotten that far. That is a lot of charges. If you charged your batteries 300 times a year, they would still last 7 years. 300 times a year is about 6 times a week. These batteries will last a long time. Make sure you are getting genuine Panasonic Eneloop batteries. If you need more power (more current) try the black Panasonic Eneloop Pro battery.
customer_reviews.author: William StevensTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and not any better than some of the cheaper brands.
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 sets of rechargeable batteries. EBL , these and Amazon Basics silver. I ordered these hoping they held a charge longer than the others that I bought. I was hoping since they were more expensive and from a reputable brand that it would be a significant improvement. Nope! They are the same. I use them in my Kholer touchless toilet tank sensors which burn through 4AA batteries every few weeks. I have swapped all three brands in the toilets and have seen no difference in longevity. Moral of the story, save your money and get the Amazon Basics for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Hyams

customer_reviews.title: Looks to be previously returned
customer_reviews.text: I can't comment on the quality of the batteries because I'm considering returning them. When the package arrived, the batteries were all loose and rolling around in the envelope. The plastic clam shell separated from the cardboard backing. It looks like someone had maybe glued it back together. Those things are hard enough to open that I know it would not have come off if this package was truly brand new. Giving 3 stars because I don't want to diss the batteries. Eneloops have a reputation for being very good. If I decide to keep them I will update this review after I have used them for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: rbgiantfan

customer_reviews.title: These are the only batteries that I use
customer_reviews.text: As a photographer, I need a battery that I can count for reliability and power. These batteries are all of that. They can handle multiple flash discharges at a fast rate and consistent power output until the batteries are spent. Charging time is a little low, but to sustain the power demands of rapid discharge, a slow charging process is necessary. If you have a job or hobby that requires high power demands, this is the battery to use.
customer_reviews.author: Of Brian Photography

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For - Better than the "Knock Offs"
customer_reviews.text: I used the Amazon branded batteries for a long time, but after a couple years of use those could only charge to fractions of what it was new. While that's okay for my house hold goods, I don't want to worry about it while I'm on the location for photoshoots. While I've been told the Amazon brand is made in the same factory as the Eneloop batteries, it doesn't seem to hold up to the same standard. For the price, the Amazon ones are good enough for my TV remote and Xbox controllers, but the Eneloops are the ones that go into the camera bag!
customer_reviews.author: Vinh

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and long-lasting
customer_reviews.text: I've been using lots of Eneloops for many years in my business. They've been reliable, almost never failed, and held a good charge for many months when stored. They work really well in high-drain uses such as camera flashes, as well as in low-drain uses like children's toys. Tried other brands, but they were no cheaper and some failed after 2-3 years. Now I buy nothing but Eneloops. I almost never buy disposable batteries any more.
customer_reviews.author: Jacques Cornell

customer_reviews.title: Can run motorized blinds for over a year.
customer_reviews.text: I bought thirty two of these batteries in order to run some Somas motorized blinds. Each blind takes six of these batteries. I charged them all up, and installed them. I expected they would last a few months before I had to recharge them. But it is not a year later, and all the batteries are still going strong. The blinds are opened and closed every day, sometimes more than once. I have also started ordering them to use in place of other AA and AAA batteries as they fail. In each device they last as long than regular AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: ZapD

customer_reviews.title: Working well so far
customer_reviews.text: I have cycled through these 3 times so far, using them in trail cameras outdoors, LED lights in a cabin, etc. So far, they take a charge higher than rated, show little loss of power after storage for two months, and provide plenty of run time. Hopefully they will prove durable over time. I am pleased to avoid throwing away so many batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Hurricane

customer_reviews.title: 3rd 16 battery eneloop battery purchase with a bad battery that won't charge.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third purchase of 16 eneloop batteries that I've purchased in the past several weeks. The first had two bad batteries in the batch, Amazon replaced but the second batch also had 2 bad batteries. Now this third batch also has a bad battery that cannot be charged. Very disappointing to buy what should be premium batteries and receive 1 or 2 unchargable batteries each time.
customer_reviews.author: RogerEH

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be foolish
customer_reviews.text: Stop buying batteries. These things last for years and years if you are not using them for photography. Even for photography they still last for years and years but for your average remote or anything you need to use them for in your household. You will save hundreds of dollars if not $1000 depending on how many batters you go through. I have use these for 15 years now and they have never let me down. The only reason I keep buying more is because I have three kids and every electronica that they get obviously takes a battery.
customer_reviews.author: Nc777ww

customer_reviews.title: Few deteriorating batteries
customer_reviews.text: I bought 32 batteries. I cycled them few times in charger, then completely discharged and measured their capacity. None exceeded 1850mAh, 6 were below 1800 mAh. Majority were in 55-65 mOhm internal resistance, but three were 100+ mOhm, which signals deterioration. Overall 10% questionable batteries, and the "up to 2000mAh" claim is false, should be "up to 1850 mAh if you are lucky".
customer_reviews.author: duliskov

customer_reviews.title: Eneloop 1900 mAh “seem to be” the ticket
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t know yet. I saw a utube video on these “eneloop” & was very impressed. Normally, I’d use 2400 mAh These are 1900 mAh. I am a rechargeable battery user. Always hunting the best. I hope to go back & change my rating as it takes time to know. I use these in my solar lights & my 9 set of battery candles which I did order & reviewed as Great from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine Johnson

customer_reviews.title: LOW VOLTAGE BATTERIES
customer_reviews.text: The batteries came charged t0 1.35 volts and when fully charged (green LED light was off), they only had 1.45 volts. Most devices start malfunctioning when the voltage drops below 1.4 volts. However, if the Panasonic Eneloop batteries maintain the 1.45 volts for along time, then they may be as good as Alkaline batteries which come with a pre-charge of 1.5 - 1.6 volts. I also purchased the Panasonic Eneloop batteries and they had the same voltage issue.
customer_reviews.author: Yonko Mali

customer_reviews.title: YES!!! Always have fresh batteries and don't contribute to landfills
customer_reviews.text: We have a plethora of eneloop rechargeable batteries and have used them for years. I bought this multipack as we now have grandchildren whose toys require many batteries. Always have fresh batteries on hand and don't contribute to landfills. The original eneloop batters we bought are still going strong - at least 7 years later (maybe more). Would highly recommend to anyone. Make sure you have the corresponding charger.
customer_reviews.author: Loz1217

customer_reviews.title: Great rechargeable batteries, Genuine Eneloop Battery
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Eneloop AA rechargeable batteries in our church for over 3 years. They have been recharged about 468 times each. I use the for wireless microphones that are used 3 times per week. These are original Eneloop AA batteries, and some of the fake ones out there. I highly recommend these for anyone that uses a lot of batteries. They will definitely pay for themselves in a short time. I plan on using the batteries for my Nikon Coolpix 5000 camera with the extended battery pack. The camera is very hard on AA Alkaline Heavy Duty batteries, so this should help on expenses.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Harriman

customer_reviews.title: Best rechargable batteries I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I bought some of these several years ago, and they are still going strong, so when my church needed some rechargeable batteries for our wireless mics, I bought a bunch of these. Same great quality, same great service. In my opinion, these are the finest AA rechargeable batteries you can get!
customer_reviews.author: WM5E

customer_reviews.title: received batteries that were low on charge and batteries lose charge after just a few hours
customer_reviews.text: purchased the 16 pack after having positive experience with Eneloop batteries in the past. However, these arrived with little to no charge, even in my thermostat it showed low voltage. I went ahead and charged them up, put them into the thermostat and it still shows low voltage, repeat this 4x with different batteries from the pack with same/similar results. best time it didn't show low voltage for about 24 hours, then returned to showing low voltage. returned for replacement, lets see if the next set is the same... Others have reported the same issue recently as well
customer_reviews.author: Lala

customer_reviews.title: They just work, year after year. I've tried so many others, Eneloops are the best.
customer_reviews.text: Eneloop is hands down the best. I've tried others with higher, wilder claims and they always crap out. Eneloops simply just last, and work, and keep working. Year after year. Get a nice LaCrosse charger and these will last years. I use a BC700 , i have 4 of them and about 30 Eneloop AA and about a dozen eneloop AAA . Never a dud or one that petered out early. ***update* Aug 2020: They're all outlasting everything else, all those that claim more mAH , these white Eneloops are still the best.
customer_reviews.author: SubwayRocket

customer_reviews.title: Bought "sold by Amazon," got genuine, made in Japan batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Bought mine July 2020, sold by Amazon. I got white, made in Japan, the package is marked 2000mAh or 1900mAh, depending on how it's measured. Either way they perform as I would expect Eneloops to perform. I see in the reviews that some people have received what appears to be counterfeits. I'm not surprised. At this point, I would only buy these as "sold and shipped by Amazon" (or some other big box store) and not from a third party, even if they're shipped by Amazon. Counterfeiting is a real problem that A doesn't have a handle on yet.
customer_reviews.author: James Hightower

customer_reviews.title: Eneloop are the best
customer_reviews.text: I've been using them since 2008, and what I mean by that is I have 2008 batteries still in rotation that still hold a charge. Not as good as my 2019, but I would say as good as a brand new Duracell. If you don't know about them just buy them and give them a try. Seriously I have not purchased a battery outside of my Eneloops AAA or AA in 11 years.
customer_reviews.author: Isamuog

customer_reviews.title: Working well in solar landscape lights
customer_reviews.text: After a few years of faithful service, I thought our landscape solar pathway lights would have to be replaced when they stopped coming on. After checking the rechargeable batteries in the covers, I realized a lot of them were leaking and probably just needed to be replaced. Once these were installed, the lights were glowing brightly all night again. Arriving partially charged, they did start breathing life into the pathway lights the very first evening and have been carrying a solid charge for over two months now. Very pleased with these batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy C

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay charged!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed something for my digital camera that wouldn't die after 2 pictures. I got a 4 pack of these batteries that came with a charger. They worked wonderfully so I bought a set of 16. They come "pre charged". I tried to use some and they didn't work so I tested the charge and they needed to be charged, so I charged all 16 of them. Two weeks later, they were dead again, just sitting waiting to be used. So I charged them all again and now 2 weeks later they are all dead again! They are supposed to stay charged for 7 years for crying out loud!.
customer_reviews.author: Becky DempseyTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: These batteries hold a charge for a very long time! I have them in some remote controlled timer candles...Its so great to have these candles come on at dusk and shut off after 5 hours - and with these batteries I 1) rarely have to change them because they hold the charge for so long and 2) they recharge quickly. Our charger charges them within 15 minutes! It feels really good to not always be throwing out used batteries. Get some!
customer_reviews.author: Angel Ahh

customer_reviews.title: They're good batteries, but I ordered the ones pictured (updated JAN 2020)
customer_reviews.text: They're good batteries, but I ordered the ones pictured. Got blue batteries instead. Seems the white batteries just work a little bit better for some reason. Maybe the white ones hold a charge better? More capacity? Whatever it is, these blue batteries are slightly disappointing. I wish Panasonic would come out into the open and explain what the difference is, if any, between white and blue. Updated JAN 2020: Well, guess I'll have to eat my words a bit. I was sent the blue Eneloop batteries, but got white ones in AAA size. I have been severely disappointed in the AAA batteries, but the blue AA's continue to impress the heck out of me!
customer_reviews.author: some1else

customer_reviews.title: Best rechargeable batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I love eneloop batteries. They never disappoint! one of the biggest annoyances with rechargeable is that when you need them, they usually need to be charged. I find with these, I never have that problem. They hold their charge for years whether in use or not-I have replaced all of mine with eneloop.
customer_reviews.author: Lyfeizgudd

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Best Rechargeable batteries! They come precharged and they maintain charged for a long period of time. I haven't noticed any difference in replacing these batteries with one time use batteries. They last just as long if not longer in devices.
customer_reviews.author: Crvnts

customer_reviews.title: The Best NiMH batteries
customer_reviews.text: Eneloop are hands down the best made NiMH batteries I've bought them about 5 times now, and used them for about 5 years, and I've yet to have any issue with any battery. Really the only downside is that they are a bit expensive, but I'd rather pay a little more rather than save a few dollars to get some cheap Chinese batteries that randomly fail.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Komuves

customer_reviews.title: Best rechargeable batteries available
customer_reviews.text: Have not opened these yet but I own many dozens of eneloop rechargeable batteries and they are the consistently the best. I own Harbor Freight brand, Ikea brand and several other off brands. Eneloops last longest, charge evenly and are an (undetectible) hair slimmer than the other brands which makes them easier to fit in my flashlight cartridges. Delivery was by UPS and they DID NOT follow my delivery instructions at all. They left the package out by my mailbox and by some miracle it did not get stolen. UPS, please pay attention!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Batteries
customer_reviews.text: I always use rechargeables, and usually either these Eneloop or Duracell. I have some power window shades, each of which use 8 batteries that are stored in a tube. They had Duracell's in them, and when I tried to remove them to recharge, I had a heck of a time trying to get the batteries out of the tube. They were too tight in width. They must expand with use. This is not a problem with the Eneloop, so will always use this brand from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as EBL
customer_reviews.text: I've bought many Enloop, EBL and Amazon Basics batteries (AA & AAA) in the past several years. All of them are working fine so far except for a couple that I killed by mistake (used an old charger that overcharged). You may see some differences in the numbers if you use one of those gauges, but I don't see any practical difference between the brands (I don't mix them up). At least not enough to justify the price gaps. I'm still a bit inclined to Enloop, but wouldn't mind buying EBL or AmazonBasics if I find a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDwellerTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Loose batteries in envelope, box opened
customer_reviews.text: Saw all of the 1 star reviews describing open box and batteries either not charged or defective, add another to the list of what looks like used batteries. Not taking the chance, returning at once. Disappointed as I have had good luck with these before, but how do I know if these batteries are new or not? I didn't just pay this kind of money to not be sure.
customer_reviews.author: C. Grimsley

customer_reviews.title: Best rechargeable battery on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best rechargeable batteries on the market. I have used Eneloops ever since they were made by Sanyo and I love them. I have tried some of the other battery brands and they cannot match these batteries. I primarily use them in my camera flashes and they work much better than alkalines, providing not only faster recycle but longer lasting as well. Use these batteries with a quality charger (not a 15-minute fast charger) and they will last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Smith

customer_reviews.title: I have a ton of these batteries and they are great
customer_reviews.text: These are the best batteries on the market in my experiences. I have had a few sets of these for years and none of them have failed or lost capacity yet. Their long standby times make them good for all around usage in any normal device (like a clock or remote or radio) but also great for high power devices (like christmas decorations, fans or other portable battery systems). This christmas I just bought another 32 of these batteries (16AA & 16AAA) for use in all my decorations around the house!
customer_reviews.author: Jimster480

customer_reviews.title: Don't Replace, Recharge
customer_reviews.text: I have many LED candles that use AA batteries. Even with the buying in bulk at Costco, it was costing a lot to keep them all lit. I started to switch to rechargables and have been pleased with the performance. They may not last quite as long as a regular battery, but then I can recharge them and they're good as new. Love these and highly recommend them for all your AA battery needs.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and great for the environment
customer_reviews.text: eneloop batteries are renowned for holding a charge for a very long time, and lasting for many recharge cycles. They are the ONLY rechargeable batteries I buy now after having less than ideal performance on other brands, and they DO NOT LEAK like alkaline batteries do. They may not work in all devices since the voltage of all rechargeable batteries is a bit lower than throwaway batteries, but in those few devices I use photo lithium batteries as they too do not leak like alkalines. And keep in mind that you are not throwing alkaline batteries in the trash anymore once you make the switch to rechargeables!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce BTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Previous version lasted about six years !
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my Canon 600 ex rt speed lights and do personal travel photography. I use a Lacrosse smart charger that can check, charge, refresh and give me a good look at the individual status of the batteries. I have had some batteries loose their potential to hold a charge along the way that needed replacement. This combination has me pretty secure in knowing I have power for an entire week (if needed) I keep my gear in a rolling camera case(because of weight) and try to jump a plane every three months and these batteries hold up a charge beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: mostdangerous city in the usa El Paso

customer_reviews.title: Work as well as the disposable batteries
customer_reviews.text: These are great. The battery life is on par with the disposables, and the charge time is reasonable. I haven't had them long enough to comment on their ability to hold charge as time passes. You will definitely save money in the long run if you have items that drain batteries quickly. In my case, these are items are toys for my kids. The charger is a bit unintuitive. The light means it is charging while no light means that it is charged.
customer_reviews.author: SkinOfEvil

customer_reviews.title: Best batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE these. We use batteries like crazy and I hated the waste of money and lack of ecological safety, so I got these. They are wonderful. They last long, and charge quickly. I got the kit that has multiple sizes and a charger, but it just didn't have enough AAs for us. This was a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Green

customer_reviews.title: 2 Batteries did not charge
customer_reviews.text: Brand new, and 2 would not charge. Makes me wonder about long-term longevity of these. Anyway, we will see. Seems like most batteries are just poorly made these days. I stopped using anything other than rechargeable batteries because ALL other alkaline batteries end up leaking and destroying the devices they are in.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Worth

customer_reviews.title: Got real ones.
customer_reviews.text: Got real eneloops and they work fantastic. Not sure what more to say other than read the reviews and other guides online that tell you how to verify they are real.
customer_reviews.author: CovertLeopard

customer_reviews.title: First rechargeables we’ve committed to
customer_reviews.text: Over the last 15 years we’ve tried to do rechargeable a few times. Don’t know if it’s the brand or the jump in technology, but these have been the greatest. We have lots of battery things now For our multiplicity of tiny children, and we have a healthy collection of this brand now. Never any problems. Charge well, decent life (some toys will always be battery hogs no matter what you use), never a leaky battery. Had some for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: ChaCha

customer_reviews.title: Most amazing batteries
customer_reviews.text: Not only do they hold a charge, I've had them in flashlights that are rarely used and 3 years later the flashlight lights up bright like it has new batteries, but they also seem to almost as long as disposable alkaline batteries. Using these will really save you money in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: W. Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I get these sooner?
customer_reviews.text: Recently had to replace batteries in a lot of the kids items. Decided to check into rechargeable batteries to cut down on overall cost and waste. Decided to give eneloop batteries a try and am completely satisfied so far. They charge up quickly and last as expected, will be ordering more in the near future to convert all the batteries in our house to these.
customer_reviews.author: Talon4

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come fully charged
customer_reviews.text: It's advertised as charged and ready, but I found them mostly around 30%. Maybe they weren't manufactured recently, with other reviews warning about older batteries having problems. They hold a decent charge now, so we will see in a few months of heavy use around the house!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Tan

customer_reviews.title: Best Ni-Hm Batteries on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent batteries! I’ve tried lots of the most popular rechargeable Ni-Mh batteries on the market. They all work. But frequently the others never even reach their capacities. And that’s with a full discharge and recharge. These batteries work right out of the package and have excellent storage properties. I use some in led lighting in various places around the house and in my Nikon photo flashes. They are excellent and worth the few dollars extra. Never had one fail! I’ve used them for years.
customer_reviews.author: Parks R.

customer_reviews.title: Eneloop are the best rechargeable batteries on the market
customer_reviews.text: Eneloop are the best rechargeable batteries on the market. My advice is to throw out every non-rechargeable battery you have and get a big pack of these. As your battery-powered devices run out of juice you will replace the batteries with these and eventually you will have an entirely rechargeable-battery-filled house. From there on out the process is simple: When a device runs out of batteries, take them out, put them on the charger immediately, and put some already-charged Eneloops from your stockpile in the device. When the old batteries are done charging, store them in your stockpile and you're good to go. These batteries last longer than any other rechargeables I've used. They are like gold in my house.
customer_reviews.author: T.H.

customer_reviews.title: No hold a charge: Panasonic BK-3MCCA16FA eneloop AA
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure I got beat. These just will not hold a charge. Prolly shoulda went w/the newest version, but a brother tried to save a buck. Shoulda stuck w/buy once cry once. No Bueno
customer_reviews.author: OldHead

customer_reviews.title: Eneloop Multi-Year results vs other NiMH brands
customer_reviews.text: Since 2010; I write the date of purchase and in-service use on each NiMH battery (multiple brands, and sources) mostly purchased on Amazon. Each are used in a variety of applications: Flashlights, digital voltmeters, string lights, toys, radios , small motors, propeller pool sweeps.... and more. Some applications, such as 4 AA string lights, require higher quality, let's say "start up current" to turn on. The brand that consistently works: Eneloop I don't have scientific evidence. Only documented dates. But for now, I won't argue with success.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: My favorite NiMH battery due to low leakage
customer_reviews.text: Eneloop batteries have become my favorite NiMH rechargeable batteries. Their low leakage means they hold their charge for much longer than standard NiMH batteries. That means you can use them in remote controls, computer mouse, electric thermometers and other similar devices where they give you longer life than the leakier standard NiMH batteries. You can get batteries with more peak capacity, but that doesn't do you much good in most applications if they drain relatively quickly even when not under load.
customer_reviews.author: CYCLNZ

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t even get to use each battery one time
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my two toddlersm white noise machines. Didn’t even get through using and recharging the entire package once before they simply didn’t hold a charge anymore. Bought these on May 8, 2019 and have been trying to rejuice them once again before writing this review, still didn’t work. Spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: ChicagoFoodie

customer_reviews.title: I received the blue one!
customer_reviews.text: I am a photographer and use eneloop batteries in all my cameras (Flim/DSLR) and Flashs and I am very happy with this brand as they last forver. However keep in mind that although the photo shown here are for the white brand, I actually received the blue brand which I am not familiar with, so I will come back and update my review once I used these for few months.
customer_reviews.author: makram

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Discharged
customer_reviews.text: Showed 50% charge upon arrival. Package looked scuffed and worn. After a complete charging cycle, discharged very quickly. I believe I was sent a bad product. Probably sat too long on some shelf or was purchased and returned. No way to tell the year of manufacture. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Lady C

customer_reviews.title: Purchased these as always
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a big fan of the enloop batteries. I still have some 5 year old ones that are still running great in various applications in my household. I needed more batteries and of course I went to the Panasonic enloops.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin S.

customer_reviews.title: Best rechargeables on the market.  Made in Japan!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot beat eneloops. I have used multiple brands of rechargable batteries, and they all quit working after several years, but not eneloops. They are still functioning as good as they did 7-8 years ago. Infact I have the old Sanyo ones and can't believe they still work, and work well. So when it came time to buy more rechargeable batteries (completely going with rechargeables now) it was a no brainier. They might cost a little more, but you will be saving more in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: hesty24

customer_reviews.title: This has to be some old garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I lost my faith in 3rd party sellers. I have to recharge them for my remote controls once a week or 2. What 10 years. Complete Garbage! I don't know why the POS got so many 5 stars. Get Amazon Basics Batteries - for the money it will actually last you a long time next to these.
customer_reviews.author: S.N.

customer_reviews.title: POOR Performance of batteries
customer_reviews.text: I have given these AA a good test. I bought them to work with my Panasonic KX-TGF575S phones. I Charged them up a SLOW Trickle charge. We are lucky if they last the day before getting so low I have to re-charge them. I bought them because they are suppose to last. The OLD batteries last longer then these. We only use them for about 2 hours a day MAX. VERY DISAPPOINTED DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Paula Gleitz

customer_reviews.title: Not fully charged as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only charge these batteries twice but do far so good. The reason I did not give these a 5 star is that they are advertised as fully charged and will hold a 70% charge for a year. I put these on my charger and they were not fully charged and I would say since the voltage checked at only 1.35 volts they were not even near 70% charged.
customer_reviews.author: Irving

customer_reviews.title: Eneloop.
customer_reviews.text: Every single time I think of rechargeable batteries for my camera gear, I think of eneloop. I was never wrong with this. Eneloops batteries are just amazing. Bought them in bulk for flashes, lights, strobes, transmitter, remote control, everywhere. This batteries are top of the notch when talking about rechargeable batteries. Can't go wrong with eneloop.
customer_reviews.author: Matias F.

customer_reviews.title: Eneloops are the best rechargeable batteries for low drain situations.
customer_reviews.text: IMO these are the best batteries to use in lower drain rechargeable situations, like wireless keyboards, fancy universal remotes, and they're pretty nice for flashlights too. Make sure to purchase a good charger for them. I'm a fan of my nitecore D4, but there are others more suited for NI-MH rechargeable that might be better, but i also use lithium batteries so it was a no brainer for me. Used eneloops for years (first got some around when GW Bush was re-elected) hard to kill them unless you use a bad charger. Also, no harm in charging them early, which is a plus in my book.
customer_reviews.author: EN Wags

customer_reviews.title: It's definitely worth the purchase you will save a lot of money in the long run
customer_reviews.text: So I did a little splurging on these batteries because we had been going through batteries daily at my house. My son got some battery operated Thomas the trains and he likes to leave them on all the time period so I needed to find batteries that I could use over and over and these seem to be the perfect fit. If you have kids toys at her being used a lot require batteries I highly recommend this and getting the wall charger that they sell separately. I highly recommend these battery so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Marie Plaunty

customer_reviews.title: CONSISTENT QUALITY & LONG LASTING
customer_reviews.text: As for a very good rechargeable battery, I have to give these 5 stars... But, only when purchased on sale because their normal price is a bit high. I get about the same use and quality from my Duracell batteries which cost less; Energizers are pretty good too. Still, for your high-end, high use electronic gadgets, these are among the best to use. For other basic (e.g. remotes & key fobs, et al) devices, I recommend a basic lower cost battery.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: I love rechargeable batteries
customer_reviews.text: I love rechargeable batteries. I don't mind paying more for rechargeable because I save more in the long run. I am not sure if it's because the humidity where I live but our batteries tend to leak very often way before the exp date. We threw away so many toys and electronics due to the corrosion. So far, all our items with rechargeable batteries have not leaked. I've been using rechargeable for about 2 years now. Good to have backups while charging. I bought these for my kids new vtech camera.
customer_reviews.author: Hilo

customer_reviews.title: Buy from a store
customer_reviews.text: These batteries never charge to full.. checked with meter and although the charger says it's charged it'd only at 70%... buy from a store I think the one sold here ate old stock
customer_reviews.author: Rez jr

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money. Great for the environment.
customer_reviews.text: Rechargeable batteries are fantastic for both my wallet and the environment. You pay a bit more up front, but it's worth it in the end. Plus, these come fully charged, so if you're like me, and you're having trouble locating the cord to your charger, you have a little while before you'll truly need it. (And with little kids in the house, when you need so many batteries for so many toys, rechargeables are a lifesaver.)
customer_reviews.author: Casey May

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, pre-charged batteries
customer_reviews.text: Batteries came precharged, which is an added bonus. Unlike other brands that are used in my household, they do keep charge pretty well. I have not measured exactly how long, but from perception standpoint, at least 6 months. Unlike other brands, they also seem to be reliable in the number of cycles and they do not throw off my "fancy" charger, which simply won't charge batteries if something is even a little bit off with them. Pros: ------- Precharged Hold charge for a long time Reliable Cons: -------- ?
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: the last batteries you'll ever buy.
customer_reviews.text: Unless you only use a battery here and there for a remote, you will want these .. the last batteries you'll ever buy. Do buy a large capacity (8 or 16 bay) charger. I have probably 200 of these by now and never had a defective one or had any "wear out". I do a lot of location photography (eats up 40-60 of them at a go) and the NiMH batteries not only have more capacity from the start, they have higher discharge rate, so flash can cycle faster than with traditional batteries. These will pay for themselves after about 10 uses .. particularly if you have kids. We even use them in low-drain devices like remotes just because.
customer_reviews.author: M. Holstein

customer_reviews.title: I love these batteries. I definitely recommend them!
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the first picture, I have accumulated a lot of these eneloop batteries. I have not had a single issue with any of them. To keep them in one central location I purchased a plastic ammo box to store them. After constant usage they have held their capacity and as you can see from the second photo they test consistently over 2,020-2060 mAh. So I was glad that all the batteries tested above their stated rating.
customer_reviews.author: CARLOS

customer_reviews.title: great batteries but be careful!! They can start burning!!
customer_reviews.text: I have many of these batteries for my camera gear and for my kids toys. Today I had my third smoking episode and the first time with flames!!!!!!! I have reached out to eneloop and will see how they respond. BE AWARE when using these with kids toys!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: R.  Shiffer

customer_reviews.title: By far the best rechargeable cells I have bought
customer_reviews.text: By far the best rechargeable cells I have bought. They have held their charges over months of non-use and seem to run longer than the alkaline primaries I have used in the past. No worries about alkaline discharging, leaking and ruining flashlights stowed in convenient places and no problems running out of cells either. I am using these in a mouse, flashlights, cameras, remotes, clocks and solar-charged garden lights outside. The first ones I bought in 2011 work like new after numerous charge/discharge cycles. This order was not meant as replacements, I just buy some more every year and have finally used up all the primaries and am running everything completely on Eneloops.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: batteries arrived in original packaging and all cells are working
customer_reviews.text: received the batteries in original Panasonic packaging. Tested all batteries upon opening the package. All reported "Good" in battery tester. Sample of four batteries tested in 200 lumen Lantern and found working.
customer_reviews.author: P. Pimental

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, reliable battery
customer_reviews.text: I use these everywhere, from Wii-U controllers to my kitchen trash can with automatic lid. We use them at work too. I don't think I've had one failure yet in the last 3 years. Of course they have a finite life, and I expect that they will eventually reach EOL. Actual capacity varies, and I've measured some at 2100 mAh a few at 1800 mAh. Generally there around 1900-ish. Nothing to worry about since they are rechargeable, and I'm not running them in any critical application. For a general rechargeable battery, they seem to be reliable and excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: welder314

customer_reviews.title: Seriously!
customer_reviews.text: Best. Rechargeable Batteries. Ever. These batteries are awesome. They hold an excellent charge, and I haven't had to replace any of my current batteries. I bought this because my purchase of another set of rechargeable batteries dies at the rate of a battery a month. I have another set of 4 Eneloops, bought at the same time, which are cycled through even more, and that set is STILL my go-to set of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Aitken

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY rechargeable battery I will use
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many, many brands of rechargeable batteries and while most will exhibit great response and power immediately after removing from a charging device - most will quickly drop their power output. Not enough to actually cause your device to fail, but just enough to slow response on your device. We notice this mostly on remote controls. Other rechargeable batteries will work, but the response and speed of the remote suffers as the battery loses charge. The Envelop batteries JUST WORK! Well worth the extra money you have to spend. I used to shop around for rechargeable batteries, but no longer - I only purchase Envelop.
customer_reviews.author: Cleve Posey

customer_reviews.title: Tired of buying alkalines
customer_reviews.text: These Eneloop batteries are awesome, I had a set of 6 (previous version) sitting in my drawer for about a year next to the Tenergy batteries, when I tested them the Eneloop still has a solid charge where the Tenery was completely drained. So I had to buy more Eneloops! The kids go through batteries so fast with their toys, this is one of the best investments I have made.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dawgs Fam

customer_reviews.title: 100% great in 80% of devices
customer_reviews.text: These batteries are great for about 80% of devices. Having said that, they are a bit restricted by the voltage output. They work well in most kids toys, but due to the decreased voltage output, may not work well in some devices. Anything with a direct drive motor will have a decreased output. Also, things like remote controls will have a reduced output. Other than this one issue, they charge well and will save you money over the long run. Just make sure to buy enough to be able to swap out batteries during charging.
customer_reviews.author: DaninBoston

customer_reviews.title: you can't go wrong with rechargables
customer_reviews.text: I use these all the time I have purchased several packages because I use so many, they hold the charge for about 2- 3 weeks I use mine in my flame less candles I let them flicker all night long and they hold the charge well. I highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Aurora Willows

customer_reviews.title: Best rechargeable batteries I've used.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Eneloop batteries for several years, even before the brand was purchased by Panasonic. I had tried all kinds of rechargeable batteries in the past but was never satisfied with their shelf life or performance. What I love about Eneloops is that I can charge them after use and put them in storage until they're needed again, confident that they will work fine when I put them in a device even if it's months later. This is the first type of rechargeable battery that has (mostly) made it possible to stop using alkaline AA and AAA batteries for good.
customer_reviews.author: Ushuaia

customer_reviews.title: Like this brand the best for rechargeable batteries
customer_reviews.text: My husband is an electrical engineer and super picky about certain things such as batteries. We really like this brand, they are higher capacity than many others out there. I have teenagers that like to game, so having a robust battery that actually holds up to many, many charging cycles and delivers rated capacity is important, this product does all of that.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Marie Anderson-Tywlak

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst rechargeable batteries I have ever purchased. Two were damaged upon receipt and the rest didn’t even last a year. All the other rechargeable batteries that I’ve bought Have lasted for several years. Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: C Wood

customer_reviews.title: fantastic color. Been a long time since i have ...
customer_reviews.text: I received the Blue ones......fantastic color. Been a long time since i have bought Eneloop's, been using the Tenergy Blues for night light duty for the kids. I have cycled the Blue Eneloops twice now and for some reason the Tenergy LSD's out beat it. Hoping time will tell with this generation. Please take a look at the pic. The blues were cycled twice and discharged at 1amp.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Bought lots of AA and AAA rechargable batteries and Panasonic is by far the best. More expensive than other name brand or no-frills but definitely more reliable with better performance.
customer_reviews.author: Bugs Bunny

customer_reviews.title: BEST I'VE HAD!
customer_reviews.text: I've got many products that run on batteries form flash lights, razors,motion detectors and game cameras. With that said I've tried many brands and read many reviews. I have found these batteries to hold a charge in storage and cold temperature better than any. They recharge well multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: FARMER JOHN

customer_reviews.title: Rechargeable and earth friendly
customer_reviews.text: Do you know how many batteries end up in a landfill each year? Neither do I, but at least with envelop you can be assured you won’t have to continue to fill our landfills with dead or unneeded batteries. They come fully charged (that’s a plus) and are easy to plug in and charge (another plus). I like them and would highly recommend you buy some! Save the world, one battery at a time!
customer_reviews.author: Sween

customer_reviews.title: Love these batteries
customer_reviews.text: I have bee using Enelope rechargeable batteries for years. I use these in everything I own that uses batteries. I have saved hundreds of dollars and I feel good that they are ecologically friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be great batteries. They will loose a charge if they sit for an extended time but they charge easy and seem to last a good amount of time in our devices.
customer_reviews.author: Dale & Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Seem like good batteries at a fair price
customer_reviews.text: These batteries at first glance seem expensive. But they seem better at being able to stay charged during storage. And I think there is a reason that professionals use them. The latest version is number 4 which came out in 2015 and extended storage time from 5 years to 10.
customer_reviews.author: DJ620

customer_reviews.title: Lot of bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: It may seem expensive but I use these in my automatic lights that come on in the evening and they last a lot longer and can be recharged. I can have some charged when the others are recharging which I really like. I am going to use these also on the remote and game controls.
customer_reviews.author: Inez

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the best rechargeable batteries I have used. They hold the charge well, are of great quality and not a single bad one. I have tried Amazon, Sanyo and Energizer but these are my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Pirumyan

customer_reviews.title: They work great!
customer_reviews.text: We love these! We bought the starter pack with charger and various size batteries at Costco, then came here to get more AA since that is the size we use most often. These are wonderful for our Xbox controllers and wireless mouse, even the kids' toys (we do keep a list of which items have the rechargeable batteries in them so we don't inadvertently get rid of something without getting these batteries back out). I am pleased with how well they hold a charge, and of course am thrilled to no longer be going through so many disposables.
customer_reviews.author: karelle

customer_reviews.title: eneloops last a long time, hold charge
customer_reviews.text: i have a lot of rechargables and i find eneloops to be the best. they hold their charge a long time in storage, and last a long time in use. not too expensive. have not had any fail so far out of 40-50 of them, so they are reliable.
customer_reviews.author: larry o.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t had them for too long now but they all seem to have the same voltage and only years will tell if they live close to the 2100 recharges they claim. Everyone should have some rechargeables if they use batteries
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Finn

customer_reviews.title: Great rechargeable batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these rechargeable batteries and I do not regret purchasing the eneloops as opposed to a cheaper brand. I have no worries about failure. I use them mainly in Xbox 360 controllers and Rock Band instruments. These feel like they last twice as long as alkaline batteries and what's best is I just pop the spent batteries back in the charger instead of throwing them out and creating horrible waste, like an alkaline does. The Rock Band 4 drum kit seems to eat batteries and it's really great having rechargeables ready to go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie K.

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Console Battery Packs, Hello Eneloops
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my Plug and Play Kit for XB1 as I kept getting disconnected after fully recharging my controllers. After this issue, I decided to research the best rechargeable battery packs for console and the same response kept coming up "Use Eneloops." I decided to give them a shot and I am glad that I did. These are life changers for rechargeable batteries for controllers. I use them in my XB1 Controllers and also my Power A Nintendo Switch Gamecube Style Controllers.
customer_reviews.author: John Campolo

customer_reviews.title: Long life, many recharges
customer_reviews.text: These batteries deliver. They charge many times more than any others I've had and hold a long charge wherever I use them. Most of my other rechargeables have failed after a year or two. These keep on charging and holding a great charge.
customer_reviews.author: Grant B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Value & Performance by Far!
customer_reviews.text: At $32.98 price, it's the best value I've found on the net for these batteries. Straight out of the box I measured with a Fluke 87 DVM with calibration certificate and found all 16 batteries were reading 1.32 vdc and within .002 of each other. Can't find a more consistent and better performing set of rechargeable batteries. Compared to an EBL branded set that came a day later, I got varying voltages from as low as .98, high of 1.22, and in between 1.07vdc. For my money, Eneloop is the only way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Meleman

customer_reviews.title: Quality Rechargable Batteries
customer_reviews.text: Love eneloop batteries. Always keep a lot around for all my kid's toys and flash lights I use. They always last a long time, come charged in the package ready to go, and I've never had one go bad no matter how many times I've used them. They are always a quality product that I can trust. I sure hope they never change as it would be a shame.

product_meta.title: Panasonic BK-3MCCA16FA eneloop AA 2100 Cycle Ni-MH Pre-Charged Rechargeable Batteries, (package includes 16AA blue or 16AA white)
product_meta.description: eneloop NiMH "Low Self Discharge" batteries utilize Panasonic advanced rechargeable battery technology, allowing them to be recharged up to 2,100 times. eneloop batteries deliver consistent power performance, maintain 70% of their charge for up to 10 years, come pre-charged by solar power (at the factory) and are ready to use out of the package. They also have extreme temperature performance down to -4 deg F.
feature_bullets: Maintain up to 70% of their charge after 10 years (when not it use)
2000mAh type, 1900mAh min, Ni-MH pre-charged rechargeable battery
Pre-Charged at the factory using solar power and ready to use
No memory effect - batteries can be recharged when fully, or partially discharged

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
